segment.source: title: Setup Windows Containers in Azure
segment.target: title: Setup Windows Containers in Azure

segment.source: Preparing Microsoft Azure for Windows Server Containers
segment.target: Preparing Microsoft Azure for Windows Server Containers

segment.source: 12-Nov update.!!!
segment.target: 12-Nov update.!!!

segment.source: Before creating and managing Windows Server Containers in Azure you will need to deploy a Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview image which has been pre-configured with the Windows Server Containers feature.
segment.target: Before creating and managing Windows Server Containers in Azure you will need to deploy a Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview image which has been pre-configured with the Windows Server Containers feature.

segment.source: This guide will walk you through this process.
segment.target: This guide will walk you through this process.

segment.source: Other getting started guides:
segment.target: Other getting started guides:

segment.source: Run Windows Server Containers in a new Hyper-V virtual machine.
segment.target: Run Windows Server Containers in a new Hyper-V virtual machine.

segment.source: Run Windows Server Containers in an existing virtual machine
segment.target: Run Windows Server Containers in an existing virtual machine

segment.source: Setup Windows Server Containers on a physical Windows Server Core installation
segment.target: Setup Windows Server Containers on a physical Windows Server Core installation

segment.source: Start Using Azure Portal
segment.target: Start Using Azure Portal

segment.source: If you have an Azure account, skip straight to Create a Container Host VM.
segment.target: If you have an Azure account, skip straight to Create a Container Host VM.

segment.source: Go to azure.com and follow the steps for an Azure Free Trial.
segment.target: Go to azure.com and follow the steps for an Azure Free Trial.

segment.source: Sign in with your Microsoft account.
segment.target: Sign in with your Microsoft account.

segment.source: When your account is ready to go, sign into the Azure Management Portal.
segment.target: When your account is ready to go, sign into the Azure Management Portal.

segment.source: Create a Container Host VM
segment.target: Create a Container Host VM

segment.source: Click on the following link to start the VM creation process – New Windows Server Container Host in Azure.
segment.target: Click on the following link to start the VM creation process – New Windows Server Container Host in Azure.

segment.source: You can also search for the image in the Azure gallery.
segment.target: You can also search for the image in the Azure gallery.

segment.source: Click on the button.
segment.target: Click on the button.

segment.source: Give the Virtual Machine a name, select a user name and a password.
segment.target: Give the Virtual Machine a name, select a user name and a password.

segment.source: Select Optional Configuration > Endpoints > and enter an HTTP endpoint with a private and public port of 80 as seen below.
segment.target: Select Optional Configuration > Endpoints > and enter an HTTP endpoint with a private and public port of 80 as seen below.

segment.source: When completed click ok two times.
segment.target: When completed click ok two times.

segment.source: Select the button to start the Virtual Machine deployment process.
segment.target: Select the button to start the Virtual Machine deployment process.

segment.source: When the VM deployment is complete, select the connect button to start an RDP session with the Windows Server Container Host.
segment.target: When the VM deployment is complete, select the connect button to start an RDP session with the Windows Server Container Host.

segment.source: Log into the VM using the username and password specified during the VM creation wizard.
segment.target: Log into the VM using the username and password specified during the VM creation wizard.

segment.source: Once logged in you will be looking at a Windows command prompt.
segment.target: Once logged in you will be looking at a Windows command prompt.

segment.source: Video Walkthrough
segment.target: Video Walkthrough

segment.source: Next Steps - Start Using Containers
segment.target: Next Steps - Start Using Containers

segment.source: Now that you have a Windows Server 2016 system running the Windows Server Container feature jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.
segment.target: Now that you have a Windows Server 2016 system running the Windows Server Container feature jump to the following guides to begin working with Windows Server Containers and Windows Server Container images.

segment.target: Quick Start: Windows Server Containers and Docker

segment.target: Quick Start: Windows Server Containers and PowerShell
